data.description: With a company culture rooted in collaboration, expertise and innovation, we aim to promote progress and inspire our clients, employees, investors and communities to achieve their greatest potential. Our work is the catalyst that helps others achieve their goals. In short, We Enable Possibility℠.About This Internship Arch’s internship program offers students a unique opportunity to gain hands on experience in the insurance industry. It provides challenging learning experiences that serve as a foundation for interns to explore their career choices and to develop professional skills. Working alongside some of the most talented members of the specialty insurance industry, interns will gain relevant expertise in various aspects of the field, participate in learning activities and receive ongoing feedback.About This RoleSupport the CONNECT servicing portal and Spark UI applications used by Arch MI customers and internal business teams.Perform servicing functions such as loan boarding, loan updates, service transfers, cancellations, and cash management.Enhance features of the Spark application using Java, Spring Boot, and Angular to meet business team requirements.Collaborate on infrastructure components including Azure ARO (OCP), Kafka, AMQ, DataGrid, Qlik, MS SQL Server, MongoDB, DB400, Dynatrace, Splunk, and OpsGenie.Troubleshoot and optimize application performance using monitoring tools like Dynatrace and Splunk.Assist in integrating data sources and services to support scalable and reliable servicing operations.QualificationsActively completing a graduate degree in Computer Science, or relevant program.Minimum 3.0 GPA or higher. College level – Graduate student, with graduation dates ranging from December 2026 – May 2027.Proficiency in Java, Spring Boot, and JUnit required.Experience with Typescript and Angular preferred.Entrepreneurial spirit along with the desire to be a continuous learner. Team player who collaborates effectively.Self-starter who can work independently and deal effectively with multiple tasks/priorities in a fast-paced environment. Location & Work Arrangement The program dates are June 1, 2026 - August 7, 2026.This position is classified as a hybrid position. You will work 2 days onsite and 3 days from home. This position is located in Greensboro, NC.Relocation and housing assistance is not provided for this role.Timeline Arch internship positions will be posted from October 2025 and will be unposted when filled. Pay For individuals assigned to or hired to work in Greensboro, NC, the hourly rate is $26-28 as of the time of posting. The breadth in the range exists to accommodate students in specialized programs such as actuarial candidates and graduate students. Any actual rate offered will take into account a number of factors including but not limited to geographic location, scope & responsibilities of the role, along with the education & qualifications of the candidate. The above range may be modified in the future. Intern position is eligible for select Arch benefits.#LI-KK1$25 - $28 per hourDo you like solving complex business problems, working with talented colleagues and have an innovative mindset?
